head.supplied: Chief Secretary's Office, ¶ Melbourne, ¶ 21 January ¶ 1882 ¶ Sir, ¶ I have the honor ¶ ¶ to acknowledge the receipt of your letter of the ¶ 28th ultimo, ¶ communicating your desire to obtain for...

div.p: No. 234, pp. 31, 290, unit 60, VPRS 1187/P, outward registered correspondence, VA 475 Chief Secretary's Department, Public Record Office of Victoria

p.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Geneva, Geneva; text-align: end;
font-size: 12pt; font-family: Geneva, Geneva; text-align: end;

div.p:
I have the honor to acknowledge the receipt of your letter of the 28th ultimo,
Not found. See M to T. Wilson, 26 December 1881. communicating your desire to obtain for this Colony a large collection of dried plants formed by a leading botanist
Wilhelm Sonder. of Europe, at a cost of £900, and in reply to inform you that the Chief Secretary declines to entertain the proposal.

p.style: font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in; font-family: Geneva, Geneva;

div.p: I have the honor to be,

p.style: font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in; font-family: Geneva, Geneva;
font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in; font-family: Geneva, Geneva;
font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in; font-family: Geneva, Geneva;
margin-left: 0.3335in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.3335in; font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 9pt;

note.p: Document is a printed form (p. 31), with a handwritten record on a separate sheet (p. 290) of the details entered in the appropriate spaces.
